baseline_groups.claim_summary: Exposure to measles vaccination in childhood (high-measles states x post-vaccine cohort exposure) reduces adult employment probability.
baseline_groups.notes: Treatment is high_measles (median split) x exposure. Paper hypothesizes vaccination IMPROVES outcomes but simplified treatment produces negative sign.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Exposure to measles vaccination in childhood reduces adult log wages.
baseline_groups.notes: Same treatment as G1 but log wage outcome, restricted to positive wage earners.

global_notes: Major issues: (1) Several specs have identical coefs/SEs/N as baseline due to broken subsample filters. (2) robust/outcome/lnwage duplicates baseline_lnwage. (3) Simplified treatment. (4) Missing female specs. (5) FE-only specs show expected sign flips.
